THE FOREIGN SECRETARY said that Dr Benes had suggested to him that, as retribution for the german atrocities in Czechoslovakia, we should bomb the munition factories at Skoda.It was generally felt that the people of Czecho-Slovakia would now welcome this action.THE CHIEF OF THE AIR STAFF said that a lightscale attack was practicable.The War Cabinet:-MOST SECRET -Authorised the Chief of the Air staff to issue instructions that the munition factories at Skoda could be bombed, if and when the operation was feasible.Great George Street, S .77.1':
